column4: I do understand this correctly ... ubuntu 64bit is unable to play DVD's with encryption - even with multiverse enabled, unless you set up a chroot or do something else extraordinary?
I can play encripted DVDs on 64bit
: How??
I just can't freaking rip them cause for some reason Ubuntu takes it's sweet freaking time to rip
are you trying to use totem?
totem, gstreamer, mplayer, xine .. you name it ..
I can play encripted DVDs in xine... I don't know what your issue is
are you 64bit ?
last time I checked my AMD64 3200+ was 64bit.
yeah .. but you can run 32bit on a 64bit system, if you like. ...
I run 64bit Ubuntu, I have a 32bit chroot for every freaking 32bit app, it's #@$%ing annoying
Thats what I feared ..
I consider going 32bit for now ...
cause the stupid RIAS and MPAA says it's illegal...
Oh .. so its only illegal in the US?
I don't know, and I don't give a flying #$%^...
yea, why don't you do what the PLF is doing?
whoops. sorry, wrong person
plf?
nice
http://72.14.205.104/search?q=cache:hRZOoZU6Z0UJ:ubuntu.wordpress.com/2005/12/04/libdvdcss2-and-w32codecs-for-ubuntu/+libdvdcss2&hl=en&gl=ca&ct=clnk&cd=1
actually, don't do that
there are no packages there for Dapper Drake (6.06)
